hedline.hl1: Tower Air, Bankrupt, Abruptly Ends Service

abstract.p: Tower Air abuptly ceases service in midst of bankruptcy proceedings (S)0

block.p: Tower Air has stopped all scheduled passenger flights. The line, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Delaware in February, canceled a flight from Kennedy Airport in New York to Israel on May 1 without warning, stranding 300 passengers, and said it was ceasing all scheduled operations.

Tower Air has stopped all scheduled passenger flights. The line, which filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in Delaware in February, canceled a flight from Kennedy Airport in New York to Israel on May 1 without warning, stranding 300 passengers, and said it was ceasing all scheduled operations.

A recorded message at (718) 553-8500 tells ticket holders to apply to their travel agencies for refunds. If tickets were bought directly from the airline with a credit card, ticket holders should request refunds from the card company on the ground that the trip could not be made. Correspondence can be sent to Tower Air, Hangar 17, J.F.K. International Airport, Jamaica, N.Y. 11430.
